alert.note: Alert for Central Laramie County; Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; East Platte County; South Laramie Range; South Laramie Range Foothills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 29 at 1:19PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Albany, western Laramie and south central Platte Counties through 145 PM MDT... At 119 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Iron Mountain to 7 miles southeast of Crystal Lake Campground. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Cheyenne, Chugwater, South Greeley, Federal, Crystal Lake Reservoir, Crystal Lake Campground, Buford, North Crow Campground, Granite Springs Reservoir, Iron Mountain, Ranchettes, Granite Springs Campground, Warren AFB, Frontier Park, Whitaker, North Cheyenne, Horse Creek, Warren Af Base, Fox Farm-College and South Greeley High. This includes the following highways... Interstate 25 in Wyoming between mile markers 1 and 55. Interstate 80 in Wyoming between mile markers 332 and 369. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Central Laramie County; Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; East Platte County; South Laramie Range; South Laramie Range Foothills
